Appearance

HJXThe Unified UI Language

One file. HTML + CSS + JS. Zero config.

Get Started
View Examples
‚ö°

Simple Yet Powerful

Write your entire UI component in a single .hjx file. No imports, no boilerplate, no configuration.

üì¶

Zero Dependencies

Compiles to clean, dependency-free HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. No runtime overhead, no framework lock-in.

üîÑ

Reactive by Default

Built-in state management with fine-grained reactivity. Updates only what changes - blazing fast.

üñ•Ô∏è

Server-Driven Mode

Push state updates from your server via WebSocket. Perfect for real-time dashboards.

üî•

Hot Reload

Development server with instant hot module replacement. See changes as you type.

üî∑

TypeScript Support

Full TypeScript support with type-safe APIs and comprehensive documentation.

Quick Example ‚Äã

hjx
component Counter

state:
  count = 0

layout:
  view#root.card:
    text.title: "Count: {{count}}"
    button.primary (on click -> inc): "Increase"

style:
  .card { padding: 16px; border: 1px solid #ddd; border-radius: 12px; }
  .primary { padding: 10px 14px; border-radius: 10px; cursor: pointer; }

handlers:
  inc:
    set count = count + 1

That's it. One file ‚Üí a fully working interactive counter.

Why HJX? ‚Äã

FeatureHJXReactVueSvelte
Files per component13+3+1
Dependencies01+1+0
Runtime overhead0~40kb~90kb0
Learning curveLowHighMediumLow
Server-drivenYesNoNoNo

Installation ‚Äã

bash
git clone https://github.com/loayabdalslam/hjx.git
cd hjx
npm install
npm run build

Quick Start ‚Äã

bash
# Build an example
node dist/cli.js build examples/counter.hjx --out dist-app

# Start dev server with hot reload
node dist/cli.js dev examples/counter.hjx --out dist-app --port 5173

Open http://localhost:5173 and you're live!
